text: Jim Pollock (born 16 November 1958) in Newcastle is a Scottish former international rugby union player. His nickname was "Lucky Jim". Jim played eight games for Scotland between 1982 and 1985. Famously scoring on his debut against Wales, at Cardiff Arms Park where Scotland hadn't won in 20 years. Jim scored his second try against New Zealand in a 25-25 draw - to date Scotland's best ever result against the All blacks . Pollock worked as a Police Officer for Northumbria Police and also worked as a teacher Royal Grammar School, Newcastle upon Tyne. ==References== Category:Living people Category:1958 births Category:Scottish rugby union players Category:Scotland international rugby union players Category:Rugby union wings
